snippet.textDisplay: I was literally having a heart attack and my doctor's office called security and the APD  on me saying I was being disruptive instead of checking my vitals or trying to help me. I couldn't breathe and I was freaking out bbut I just asked for help but all they seen was my skin color so I was considered threatening. I'm tired and don't even feel like fighting anymore. I can't go to the store, a restaurant or anywhere and just relax and be myself. Poor baby I hope that this doesn't continue.we have to do better

snippet.textDisplay:
Hello @therealdaytime I'd like your input on this, producers or host! The biggest picture to the last statement of what school you put them in is still a screen. In society those were made to domestic us and train us for corporations as you may already know. No one was ever not educated till school told them there not. We are Infinite creators, yet habitual systems set children to think small regardless of school's. Book are out best teacher's they dont come with much judgement of who reads it. Still remember to take what you read with a grain of understanding, it's full face value we set the worth. Yall should do more and say less action speaks. Only impeccable words to the soul linger in the mind forever increasing the consciousness of those in need. Not gossip. Yall should stand for great and expose, be the trend not the follow. I'm barely on social media just to educate myself on any matter. It's just shocking how media works with all its clickbait. I'll stop.

Sincerely,
Mr. Romero

snippet.textDisplay:
Trigger Nation

This time I know where I stand
I know what’s wet I know what’s land
Unlike a world that I see
Who’ll have my head for saying “he.”

Today as thousands die of thirst
Today as Uyghurs face a curse
What really matters in the end
Is that the triggered nation trends

Assume a gender and you’ll see
Offend a Vegan and you’ll be
The lowest creature known to men
Oh no - I did it once again.

Don’t even think it in your mind
‘Cuz we can Youtube and rewind,
Then bring about a Twitter-Storm
And take some selfies while we mourn

See anything will trigger us
And empathize with us you must
Or else we’ll set our phones ablaze
And if it kills we won’t be phased

Because a vigil there will be
we’ll be there too, just die and see
But let’s be honest: in the end
What matters most are Twitter trends

Did you imply I eat too much?
Did you just say I shouldn’t touch
My seventeenth burger today?
How dare try to tell me nay.

This world where parents live in fear
Of saying “hey son, please come here,”
Lest he should one day just decide
That he is Gender-less inside.

Where female Doctors in the west
Are always trying to protest
That they don’t have their human rights;
Their income - it just isn’t right.

While they have sisters in the east
Who’re at the mercy of a beast
That seeks to kill them when they’re born
So that their mothers wail and mourn

Such screams of horror fill the sky
As hidden women wish they’d die
For they’re no more than merchandise
And stapled to their necks - their price

But just a few borders away
A poison silence seeks to slay
Groups of children eating fodder
To fill their stomachs with some water

But did you just assume my race?
Just off the colour of my face?
Wait let me just take out my phone
And watch you now be Twitter-Stoned

The science of race isn’t real
It all comes down to how I feel,
For all who dare say otherwise
Are backwards and uncivilized

But maybe it is getting time
That in this gender-fluid slime
We take a few steps back before
There is no species anymore.

snippet.textDisplay: Some black children are so disrespectful, maybe that is why they are treated differently. I am not talking about this girl in particular. But I happened to take some classes with black teenagers, they have zero respect for the teachers. My point is, before criticizing teachers or police officers we need to teach our children to respect authority. This is not one size fit all. Get involved talk to the teachers, see what is happening in the school. Teach your child to communicate, very important.

snippet.textDisplay: Sadly this does happen in all school not just charter schools. I am a parent and I also worked in the school system. I loved and hated the job. Unfortunately you never know what type of children you're going to deal with when you go to work that day. Behavior problems start at home. Alot of parents think that once their children  are in school this is they're break time and it's not my responsibility to deal with my children your the teacher you deal with it. I've seen it all, Some parents are actually engaged in there children's life. But some parents/ guardians are just living day by day and they have no time for their children cause they're to busy trying to make a living for them. It all depends on what these children see and go through at home. So we can't categorize every child as the same. As far as what Loni said that Public schools are trained to deal with children like this NO THEY ARE NOT!!!. The one this they do is probably qualify that disabled children or troubled child with a One on One. Which by the way is NOT! trained at all. It's literally is just a person who they hired to pay minimum wage and is thrown in a situation they are left to handle on their own. If some happens to the point that child has hit an adult or other child then they will escort the child to another room an empty room. Which 95% of the time the child is purposely claiming on walls, counters ext... Sadly the mess is left for everyone else to clean after they have already lost so much teaching time for the rest of the children. Sadly these things happen every day. You end up feeling bad for everyone the child that cause the disturbance, the classmate cause they can't learn, the teachers cause they can't teach. Or the Teachers supplies cause Teachers actually don't get paid or get alot of funding for they're classroom  and actually pay out of pocket for alot of their supplies. So the biggest most important question is How do you stop this from happening?

Or the Teachers supplies cause Teachers actually don't get paid or get alot of funding for they're classroom  and actually pay out of pocket for alot of their supplies. So the biggest most important question is How do you stop this from happening?

snippet.textDisplay: I agree but everyone can’t handle their child. I work in a Pediactric emergency department. I’ve seen many cases where the Police will bring the young child in handcuffed because the child is assaulting the school staff . Many parents also call the police because the child is out of hand. Also happens with autistic kids , the parents can’t really help them. They bring them In For a psychic evaluation . If they get moved to a facility they are handcuffed. It’s very hard to see , very hard ! But itself the law. I’ve had a young child , spit , bite , and punch me, had to call security .not saying the followed all the rules but this does happen more than you think. And it’s not just black children. I’ve seen more white children .

snippet.textDisplay: I just found out in cases of bullying here in the Netherlands you can have the police involved if the schools and parents don’t resolve the issue. It can go on the bullies record and everything and when I heard this is was like ‘ok.. extreme’ but perhaps necessary if they decided to put this bit of law in. Cause here we have jails closing down because the crimes rate are lower and we try to rehabilitate people not just jail them. So it made me think how the american system can be improved. A middle ground or something .. idk a police officer can have a talk with these children perhaps not with a 6 year old but put an age minimum of like 8 year old or something if this is the route the american system wants to take ..
snippet.textOriginal: I just found out in cases of bullying here in the Netherlands you can have the police involved if the schools and parents don’t resolve the issue. snippet.textDisplay:
Its absolutely disturbing that a police officer can arrest a 6 year old child at school perhaps with other kids and adults watching, that is traumatising! Every time a child throws a tantrum you cant just call the police on them and this girl has a condition that the teachers are aware of. Schools should aim to be able to be equipped to handle these sorts of situations or.. you dont know what to do? call the PARENT!
On the other hand, I used to work night shifts at shopping centres and I would watch little children aged around 7 walk in with lighters and try to steal things and the police would HAVE to come and take them away and drop them off to their parents only for them to come back and do the same thing again. Some parents really dont pay enough attention to their kids and get them the help they need. Its just really sad. But I am glad that police officer got fired because he does not deserve his badge.
snippet.textOriginal:
Its absolutely disturbing that a police officer can arrest a 6 year old child at school perhaps with other kids and adults watching, that is traumatising! Every time a child throws a tantrum you cant just call the police on them and this girl has  a condition that the teachers are aware of. Schools should aim to be able to be equipped to handle these sorts of situations or.. you dont know what to do? call the PARENT! 
On the other hand, I used to work night shifts at shopping centres and I would watch little children aged around 7 walk in with lighters and try to steal things and the police would HAVE to come and take them away and drop them off to their parents only for them to come back and do the same thing again. Some parents really dont pay enough attention to their kids and get them the help they need. Its just really sad. But I am glad that police officer got fired because he does not deserve his badge.

Ok. The racism is that bad in the USA? Because to me it seems like they overthinking things sometimes...(not really in this case...)
I'm thinking about a year now to ask this question because it seems like people in the USA are too sensitive, especially smaller groups like black people, LGBTQ members...etc.
I'm from Hungary (Europe) where there is not so many ethnics,... especially black people so that is why I'm wondering.

snippet.textDisplay:
Yo, the back of a police car is one of the NASTIEST, GERM INFESTED, areas to put a child!
That was too much as no matter WHAT they say, that is traumatizing to a child. There’s SO many sides to this, and all point to sides of mistreatment.
This is sad, regardless of the intent, she’s a CHILD, not an adult who can process how we do.
GAHHHH so frustrating 😑

snippet.textDisplay: If that was my kid, I’d burn that school down and hunt the administrator and the arresting police officer. That child got traumatized, everyone else involved will be too.

snippet.textDisplay: Wait wait..... how come they did not read the article. The child was hitting and punching adults? I think individuals should go and be a substitute teacher for a good month. That's always the first step calling the parent. Fyi sometimes the parent already know and is not surprised you were hit. Secondly, it's hard to defend or restrain the child. Any hands put on a child will be investigated just off of say so at times and then you can potentially lose your job and livelihood from protecting yourself from a child. You can dang there be smaller than the child and be told to get in fetal position. FROM A CHILD. Its hard to protect other students and yourself. Why dont you think teacher want higher pay.So put her in what room so she can destroy things, hurt herself and tire herself out. The cop restrained her from hurting ppl. He didnt hurt her and gently placed her in the car. He didnt scream at her, or call her out her name. She was basically put in time out for hitting. Where is the mom if the child was tired ? Are teachers just suppose to be beat up and take it. Would this be different for an older child? Hmm? This is not about race. People disregard the teacher at times. There is so much disrespect at times.

snippet.textDisplay: This is an example of the school to prison pipeline. These poor children are treated like criminals and that stays in their minds forever. They grow up thinking that that is the lifestyle that they were born for. As a future teacher I believe every educator and employee working with children needs to get educated in this. I feel sorry for the the child and her family.

snippet.textDisplay: You are all totally overreacting. It was a learning lesson. How many times have your parents said to you that the police men will take you if you misbehave??? He just wanted to scare her a bit. And these kids nowadays need it! Hitting 3 teachers?? If I did that I would have been more scared of my parents than the police. But today parents are „friends“ to their kids and don‘t teach respect anymore.

snippet.textDisplay: I don't know what it is like in america and the laws, I live in Australia, but my concern is that when a child is under the care of the school , the school does not let anyone take the child out of the school grounds unless they are listed as the guardian , so even if the child's dad or mum came and tried to take her home that wasn't on the systom as the adult with authority then the school will never even let them see the child let alone take them off the school grounds , I know he is a police officer but 1. He should have never been called , and 2. Regardless of his authority he should never have been allowed to take her , he could have come in and gotten to her level and maybe said " OK sweetie you have to behave , or you'll be taken in the police car " or something like that I'm not saying that's right , but maybe it would have calmed the situation and made her stop hitting or something . this whole situation could have been avoided and is so stupid on the teachers part and the officers

snippet.textDisplay: I agree with them about the 6 year old girl. That situation was handled terribly but, the the incident that Amanda mentioned is wrong. Rice showed up at a park with an air soft gun where the orange tip of the barrel was taken off and it looked like a real gun and he was pointing it at people so someone who was at the park called the cops. The orange tip is on there for a reason. To let people know it’s not a real firearm, it’s a toy. When the police arrived, he was still pointing the gun at people and he pointed it at the officers and they had no choice but, to shoot him since the officers didn’t know that the gun he was pointing at them wasn’t a real gun. That was Rice’s fault for being dumb and he was fully aware of what he was doing, two completely different instances.
snippet.textOriginal: I agree with them about the 6 year old girl. That situation was handled terribly but, the the incident that Amanda mentioned is wrong.
